source_sentence: 昔有一人，居家貧窮，為人肆力，得麨六升，齎持歸家，養育妻息。
translation: Formerly there was a man who lived in poverty at home. Because of the power of his family, he obtained six sheng of rice and carried it home to support his wife and children.

source_sentence: 會於中路，見一道人，執鉢捉錫，行求乞食，即生心念：「彼沙門者，
translation: On the way, he saw a companion in the assembly, carrying an almsbowl and holding a tin bowl. As they were walking on the road begging for food, he thought to himself:

source_sentence: 形貌端政，威儀庠序，甚可恭敬，得施一食，不亦快乎？」
translation: Your appearance is graceful, your manner is dignified, and you're very respectable. Wouldn't it be pleasant to give you a meal?

source_sentence: 爾時道人，知其心念，隨逐貧人，至一水邊，貧人即便語道人言：「我今有麨，
translation: Knowing his thoughts, the Wayfarer then followed the poor man and went to the edge of a river. The poor man said to the Wayfarer, “I am suffering from hunger now.

source_sentence: 意欲相施，頗能食不？」
translation: Will you give to each other with the intention of giving, and can you eat?

source_sentence: 道人答言：「唯得而已。」
translation: The monk replied, It's just that they get it.

source_sentence: 即於水邊，為其敷衣，令道人坐，和一升麨，用為一團，而以與之，作是念言：「若此道人，
translation: At the water's edge, he spread his robe for him, asked the monk to sit there, blended a sheng of bread into a lump, and gave it to him. He thought:

source_sentence: 是淨持戒得道人，使我現作一小國王。」
translation: This is the person who purely observes precepts and attains enlightenment, so that I'll now become a small king.

source_sentence: 道人得麨，語貧人言：「何以極少？
translation: When the monk became angry, he said to the poor man, Why is it so rare?

source_sentence: 何以極小？」
translation: Why is it so small?

source_sentence: 此人謂此道人大食，復和一升，用作一團，與而願言：「若此道人，是淨持戒得道之人，
translation: He said, “If this man of the Way is a follower of the pure precepts and attains enlightenment, how can you say that he has not renounced the householder’s life?” The bhikṣu answered, “Yes, sir.

source_sentence: 使我得作二小國王。」
translation: Enable me to become the king of two small kingdoms.

source_sentence: 道人復言：「何以極少？
translation: The monk again said, Why is it so rare?

source_sentence: 何以極小？」
translation: Why is it so small?

source_sentence: 貧人念言：「唯是道人，極似多食，與如許麨，猶嫌少小，然我已請，
translation: The poor man thought to himself, “This is just a religious practitioner who seems to have had too much food to partake of. If he allows me to partake of it, I will not accept the smallest amount [of food].

source_sentence: 事須供給。」
translation: It's necessary to make offerings.

source_sentence: 復和二升麨，用為一團，而以與之，又作念言：「若此道人，是淨持戒得道人者，
translation: Again, he mixed it with two sheng of rice and gave it to the monk as a lump. Then he had another thought:

source_sentence: 使我現得領四小國王。」
translation: I'll now be able to lead the four lesser kings.

source_sentence: 道人復言：「何以極少？
translation: The monk again said, Why is it so rare?

source_sentence: 何以極小？」
translation: Why is it so small?

source_sentence: 餘有二升，盡和作團，以與道人，又作願言：「今此道人，若是清淨持戒人者，
translation: The remaining two sheng was mixed together into a lump to be given to the religious practitioner. He also made another vow, saying: Now this religious practitioner is a pure and upholder of the precepts.

source_sentence: 使我得作波羅[木*奈]國王，領四小國，獲見諦道。」
translation: Enable me to become the king of the country of Vārāṇasī, govern four small countries, and attain the path of seeing truth.

source_sentence: 道人得麨，故嫌少小。
translation: The monks of the Way had a grudge against him, so they disliked him little.

source_sentence: 貧人白言：「唯願且食，若不足者，當脫衣裳，貿取飲食，共相供給。」
translation: The poor man said, Please let's eat; if you don't have enough, you must remove your robes and clothing, trade in food and drink, and make offerings to each other.

source_sentence: 道人即食，唯盡一升，餘還歸主。
translation: The monks then ate the food, but they ran out of one sheng and returned to their master with the rest.

source_sentence: 貧人問言：「尊者先嫌麨極少小，如今云何食不令盡？」
translation: The poor man asked, Venerable, What's the reason you didn't let your food run out?

source_sentence: 道人答言：「汝初與我一團麨時，正求作一小國王故，是以我言：『汝心願少。』
translation: The monk replied, When you first gave me a lump of bread and rice, you were correctly seeking to become the king of a small kingdom; therefore, I said, 'Your wishes are small.'

source_sentence: 第二團麨，正願得作二小國王，是以我言：『汝願少小。』
translation: The second lump of rice is correctly intended to become the king of two small kingdoms, so I say, 'May you wish for a little bit less.'

source_sentence: 第三團麨，正求得作四小國王，是以我言：『汝心願小。』
translation: The third lump of bread is correctly seeking to become the king of the four lesser kingdoms, so I say, 'Your mind wishes for smallness.'

source_sentence: 第四團麨，正求作波羅[木*奈]國王，領四小國，使我後得見諦道果，
translation: In the fourth monastery he sought to become king of Vārāṇasī and ruled over four small countries, thereby enabling me later to attain the fruit of the path of insight.

source_sentence: 是以我言：『汝願少小。』
translation: That's why I said, 'Your vow is small.'

source_sentence: 不以不足而慊少小。」
translation: It's not because they aren't sufficient and the crude is small.

source_sentence: 爾時貧人，自生疑念：「使我現得王五國者，此事不小，恐無實耳。」
translation: It was then that the poor man had doubts of his own mind, saying, If I were to attain the kingdom of the five kingdoms in the present, this wouldn't be a trivial matter; I'm afraid it wouldn't be real.

source_sentence: 又復思惟：「能知我心，必是聖人，是大福田，不應誑我。」
translation: Again, he thought, If someone can know my mind, they must be a sage; this is a great field of merit that shouldn't pity me.

source_sentence: 道人知已，即擲其鉢，著虛空中，隨後飛去，化作大身，滿於虛空；
translation: Knowing this, the bhikṣu again tossed his bowl into the sky and flew away. He transformed himself into a large body that filled the sky.

source_sentence: 又化作小，猶如微塵。
translation: It's also transformed into a small, just like a tiny particle of dust.

source_sentence: 以一身作無量身，以無量身合為一身，身上出水，身下出火，履水如地，
translation: He makes an infinite body out of one body and combines it with an infinite body into one body. Water comes out of his body, fire comes out from the bottom of his body, and he walks on water like the earth.

source_sentence: 履地如水，作十八變，語貧人言：「好發大願，莫有疑慮。」
translation: He walked on the ground like water and made 18 transformations, saying to the poor man, Good, make a great vow, don't have any doubts.

source_sentence: 即隱身去。
translation: He then departed in seclusion.

source_sentence: 時此貧人，向波羅[木*奈]城，而於道中，見一輔相。
translation: The poor man then went to the city of Vārāṇasī and saw a minister on the road.

source_sentence: 輔相見已，諦視形相，而語之言：「汝非某甲子耶？」
translation: Seeing him, the assistant examined his appearance and said to him, Isn't you a certain monk?

source_sentence: 答言：「我是。」
translation: He replied, Yes.

source_sentence: 問言：「何以襤褸乃至爾也？」
translation: He asked, What's the reason it's so crude and so forth?

source_sentence: 答言：「少失恃怙，居家喪盡，無人見看，是以困苦，襤褸如此。」
translation: He replied, I'm afraid I'll lose my support and be homeless; no one will see me. That's why I'm so distressed and tormented like this.

source_sentence: 輔相即啟波羅[木*奈]王：「王之所親某甲之子，今在門外，極為窮悴。」
translation: The assistant ministers then asked the king of Benares [munai], A certain son of the king's family is outside the gate now, and he's extremely exhausted.

source_sentence: 王尋有勅：「令使將前。」
translation: The king then ordered an envoy to go ahead.

source_sentence: 問其委曲，知是所親，王即告言：「好親近我，慎莫遠離。」
translation: Knowing that they were his relatives, the king told them, Be close to me; be careful not to get far from me.

source_sentence: 却後七日，王病命終，諸臣謀言：「王無繼嗣，唯此窮子，是王所親，
translation: Seven days after his departure, the king fell ill and died. The ministers said in council, “There is no heir apparent to the throne but this impoverished son alone is the king’s close relation.

source_sentence: 宜共推舉作波羅[木*奈]王。」
translation: It's better to promote him together as the king of Vārāṇasī [munai].

source_sentence: 統領四國，然後虐暴。
translation: He ruled the four kingdoms and then became a tyrannical ruler.

source_sentence: 先彼道人，於虛空中，當王殿前，結加趺坐，而語之言：「汝昔發願，
translation: In the sky, in front of the royal palace, he sat cross-legged and said to them, “Formerly you made a vow:

source_sentence: 求得見諦。
translation: They seek to attain the truth of seeing.

source_sentence: 今日云何乃造眾惡，與本乖違？」
translation: How did you create so many bad things today that are at odds with the original?

source_sentence: 又復為王說種種法。
translation: Again, he explained various teachings for the king.

source_sentence: 王聞法已，悔先作惡，改過慚愧，精專行道，得須陀洹。
translation: Having heard the Dharma, the king repented of his earlier evil deeds and repented of his shamefulness. He concentrated his efforts on the path and attained stream-entry.

source_sentence: （四一）貧女以兩錢布施即獲報緣
translation: (24) The poor woman gave two coins to the donor to obtain their reward.

source_sentence: 昔晝闇山中，多諸賢聖隱居眾僧。
translation: In the past, there were many sages and saints living in seclusion in the mountain of daylight and darkness.

source_sentence: 諸方國土，聞彼山名，供養者眾。
translation: In all the lands in various directions people heard the name of that mountain and offered offerings to it.

source_sentence: 有一長者，將諸眷屬，往送供養。
translation: An elderly man, accompanied by his retinues, went there to make offerings.

source_sentence: 有一貧窮乞索女人，作是念言：「今諸長者，送供詣山，必欲作會，我當往乞。」
translation: There was a poor beggar begging for a woman who had this thought, Now, the elders, sending offerings to the mountain, will surely want to make an assembly, so I'll go and beg.

source_sentence: 便向山中。
translation: He then went to the mountain.

source_sentence: 既到山已，見向長者，設種種饌，供養眾僧，私自思惟：「彼人先世修福，
translation: On arriving at the mountain, he saw various kinds of food and drink offered to the wealthy monks in front of him. In order to make offerings to the members of the sangha, he thought privately:

source_sentence: 今日富貴，今復重作功德將勝；
translation: Today I am wealthy and powerful, but now I will again perform meritorious deeds that will surely bring me victory.

source_sentence: 我先世不作，今世貧苦，今若不作，未來轉劇。」
translation: If I didn't do it in a previous life, I'll be poor and suffering in the present life; if I don't do it now, I'll suffer in the future.

source_sentence: 思惟此已，啼哭不樂，又自念言：「我曾糞中，拾得兩錢，恒常寶惜，
translation: After reflecting on this, he cried in distress and thought to himself, “I once collected two coins from a pile of cow dung. I always cherished these treasures.

source_sentence: 以俟乞索不如意時，當貿飲食用自存活。
translation: When they don't want to beg, they should trade food and drink for their own livelihood.

source_sentence: 今當持以布施眾僧，分一二日不得飲食，終不能死。」
translation: Now, you must maintain it and give it to the saṃgha, for which you won't get food or drink for a day or two, and you won't die.

source_sentence: 伺僧食訖，捉此兩錢即便布施。
translation: When he waited for the saṃgha to finish eating, he took these two coins and gave them away.

source_sentence: 彼山僧法，人有施者，維那僧前立為呪願。
translation: If someone gives a gift to the saṃgha on that mountain, he establishes a spell and vow in front of Vaiśravaṇa's saṃgha.

source_sentence: 當於爾時，上座不聽維那呪願，自為呪願。
translation: At the time, the superior monk didn't listen to Vaiśravaṇa's dhāraṇī or vow, and he made his own dhāraṇī or vow.

source_sentence: 諸下坐等，深生慊心，而作此念：「得彼乞女兩枚小錢，上座自輕，為其呪願，
translation: The assembled monks and nuns had deep feelings of anger and thought, “If we were to obtain two pieces of coin for the beggar’s daughter, the superior monk would despise himself.

source_sentence: 如常見錢，何以不爾？」
translation: If you see money, why isn't it like that?

source_sentence: 上座尋時，留半分食，與此女人。
translation: When the superior monk sought it, he left half a meal and gave it to this woman.

source_sentence: 諸人見上座多與，人人多與。
translation: The people saw that the superior monk gave much, and everyone gave it.

source_sentence: 此女時得重擔飲食，極大歡喜：「我適布施，今以得報。」
translation: The woman then obtained a heavy load of food and drink and was overjoyed, rejoicing greatly, It's appropriate for me to give alms, but now I'll get the reward.

source_sentence: 即擔飲食還出山去，到一樹下，眠臥止息。
translation: He then returned out of the mountain with food and drink, went to a tree, slept, lay down, and stopped.

source_sentence: 會值王大夫人亡來七日，王遣使者，按行國界，誰有福德？
translation: On the seventh day after the demise of the king's great wife, the king sent an envoy to travel around the borders of his country, but who had any merit?

source_sentence: 應為夫人。
translation: You should become a wife.

source_sentence: 相師占言此黃雲蓋下，必有賢人。
translation: The soothsayer said, “Below this canopy of the yellow clouds there must be a wise man.

source_sentence: 即共相將，至彼樹下。
translation: They then went to the foot of that tree together with their general.

source_sentence: 見彼女人，顏色潤澤，有福德相，樹為曲蔭，光影不移，相師言：「此女人福德，
translation: Seeing that the woman’s complexion was lustrous and her features endowed with blessed virtue, she drew shade from the trees. The light and shadow did not move. The soothsayer said:

source_sentence: 堪為夫人。」
translation: She's capable of becoming a wife.

source_sentence: 即以香湯沐浴，與夫人衣服，不大不小與身相稱，千乘萬騎，左右導從，
translation: He bathed himself in scented warm water, gave his wife’s clothes, and presented them to her. They were neither too big nor too small to measure the length of their bodies, with a thousand chariots drawn by ten thousand horsemen following him on both sides.

source_sentence: 將來至宮。
translation: He was about to arrive at the palace.

source_sentence: 王見歡喜，心生敬重，如是數時，私自念言：「我所以得是富福緣，以施錢故。
translation: The king was delighted to see this and respectfully thought to himself, “This is the reason I am so wealthy and blessed.

source_sentence: 今彼眾僧，便為於我有大重恩。」
translation: Now, those monks will give me a great deal of kindness for my sake.

source_sentence: 即白王言：「我先斯賤，王見拔擢，得為人次，聽我報彼眾僧之恩。」
translation: He then said to the king, I've been lowly before, but when the king saw me uprooted and promoted, he was able to follow them as a human being and hear me repay the kindness of those monks.

source_sentence: 王言：「隨意。」
translation: The king said, As you wish.

source_sentence: 夫人即時，車載飲食及以珍寶，往到彼山施僧食訖，以寶布施。
translation: Immediately, the queen's chariot carries food and drink and other rare treasures, goes to the other monastery, gives them to the saṃgha after they finish eating, and distributes them as treasures.

source_sentence: 上座不起，遣維那呪願，不自呪願。
translation: The superior monk doesn't arise, sends the vow to Vaiśravaṇa, and doesn't make his own vow.

source_sentence: 王夫人言：「我昔兩錢，為我呪願；
translation: The king’s queen said, “Formerly I gave you two coins to make a vow of incantations for me.

source_sentence: 今車載珍寶，不為我呪願？」
translation: Now that you're carrying treasures in your chariot, won't you curse and vow for me?

source_sentence: 諸年少比丘，皆慊上坐，先貧女人，以兩錢布施，為其呪願，今王夫人，
translation: All the young bhikṣus sat cross-legged in the upper chamber. The formerly poor woman offered them two coins as a mantra and vow, saying, “The king’s wife is now my wife!

source_sentence: 車載珍寶，不為呪願，為老耄耶？
translation: Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is Is

source_sentence: 爾時上座，即為王夫人，演說正法語言：「夫人！
translation: It was then that the superior monk spoke the right teaching for the king's wife, saying, Mrs.!

source_sentence: 心念慊我：『先以兩錢施時，為我呪願，今車載珍寶，不為呪願。』
translation: He thought to pity me in his mind, 'When he gave me two coins, he made a dhāraṇī vow for me, but now the chariot carries treasure and doesn't make a dhāraṇī vow.'

source_sentence: 我佛法中，不貴珍寶，唯貴善心。
translation: In the Buddha's teaching, we don't treasure treasure treasure treasure treasures; we value only good thoughts.

source_sentence: 夫人！
translation: Lady!

source_sentence: 先施兩錢之時，善心極勝，後施珍寶，吾我貢高，是以我今不與呪願。
translation: When I first gave the two coins, my good intention was so superior that later I gave them as a gift of rare treasures and became arrogant. That's why I won't give them to you now because of this spell or vow.

source_sentence: 年少道人！
translation: Young man of the Way!

source_sentence: 亦莫慊我，汝當深解出家之心。」
translation: Don't pity me, either; you must deeply understand the mind of leaving home.

source_sentence: 諸年少道人，各自慚愧，皆得須陀洹道。
translation: The young monks and nuns, each ashamed of their shame, all attained the stream entry path.

source_sentence: 王夫人聽法，慚愧歡喜，亦得須陀洹道。
translation: The king's wife heard the teaching, and she was shameful and rejoiced, and she also attained the stream entry path.

source_sentence: 聽法已訖，作禮而去。
translation: Having heard the Dharma, he paid his respects and departed.

source_sentence: （四二）◎乾陀衛國畫師罽那設食獲報緣
translation: (482) ◎ The story of the karmic retribution of the painters in Gandhāravyūha's country of Kaṇṭhinaśāsa

source_sentence: 昔乾陀衛國，有一畫師，名曰罽那，三年客作，得三十兩金，欲還歸家，
translation: Formerly in the country of Gandhāra there was a painter named Guna, who had been engaged in painting for three years. He obtained thirty taels of gold and wished to return home.

source_sentence: 而見他作般遮于瑟，問維那言：「一日作會，可用幾許？」
translation: When he saw him performing a parinirvāṇa, he asked Vaiśravaṇa, How much time will it take to make the assembly one day?

source_sentence: 維那答言：「用三十兩金，得一日會。」
translation: Vairocana replied, Use thirty taels of gold to get a day's worth of meeting.

source_sentence: 即自念言：「由我先身不種福業故受此報，傭力自活，今遭福田，云何不作？」
translation: He then thought to himself, It's because I didn't plant good actions in my previous life that I received this retribution, and I worked as a servant for my own livelihood; now that I've been given a field of merit, why won't I do it?

source_sentence: 即語維那：「請為弟子，鳴椎集僧，我欲設會。」
translation: He said to Vairocana, Invited as a disciple, I'll ring the bell to gather the saṃgha, and I want to set up an assembly.

source_sentence: 設會已訖，踊躍歡喜，即便歸家。
translation: Having set up the assembly, they all jumped for joy and immediately returned home.

source_sentence: 既到家已，其婦問言：「三年客作，錢財所在？」
translation: When she arrived home, the woman asked, Where is the money and possessions of the three-year guest's work?

source_sentence: 其夫答言：「我所得財，今已舉著堅牢藏中。」
translation: The husband answered, My possessions have now been lifted up into a sturdy storehouse.

source_sentence: 婦時問言：「堅牢之藏，今在何許？」
translation: The woman then asked, Where's the storehouse of firmness now?

source_sentence: 夫言：「乃在僧中。」
translation: The husband said, It's among the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 婦時慊責，即集親里，縛其夫主，詣斷事人，而作是言：「我之母子，
translation: The woman was then angrily reprimanded, gathered her relatives in the village, bound her husband and wife, went to the abstinence practitioner, and said, My mother and child,

source_sentence: 貧窮辛苦，無衣無食，而我夫主，得財餘用，不擔來歸，請詰所以。」
translation: They're poor and hard-pressed, with no clothing or food, but my husband gets the rest of his wealth and doesn't carry it back and forth, so I'm asking him to explain why.

source_sentence: 時斷事人，問其夫言：「何以爾也？」
translation: The person who cut off the servants then asked their husband, Why is that?

source_sentence: 答言：「我身如電光不久照曜，亦如朝露須臾則滅，由是恐懼，深自念言：『緣我前身不作福業，
translation: He replied, My body is like a flash of lightning that doesn't shine for long, and it's like morning dew that goes out in a moment.

source_sentence: 今遭窮苦，衣食困乏。』
translation: Now I'm suffering from hunger and poverty, with scarce food and clothing.'

source_sentence: 故因見彼弗迦羅城中，作般遮會，眾僧清淨，心生歡喜，敬信內發，即問維那：『得幾許物，
translation: Having thus observed the parinirvāṇa assembly at Puṣkarava’s city, where all the monks were pure and genuinely enlightened, Vimalakīrti was overjoyed. With respect and faith he said to Vaiśravaṇa, “How much did you obtain?” Vaiśravaṇa replied:

source_sentence: 供一日食？』
translation: Suppose you were to offer food for a day?'

source_sentence: 維那答言：『得三十兩金，可得供一日。』
translation: Vairocana replied, 'I'll get thirty taels of gold that can be offered for one day.'

source_sentence: 我三年中，作所得物，即與維那，使為眾僧作一日食。」
translation: In the third year, I made a gift of what I had obtained, gave it to Vaiśravaṇa and asked him to make a meal for the saṃgha for one day.

source_sentence: 時斷事人，聞是語已，心生歡喜，憐愍其人，脫己衣服瓔珞及以鞍馬并諸乘具，
translation: Having heard these words, the official in charge of the monastery was overjoyed and felt pity for the man. He took off his clothes, jewelry, saddles, horses, and other means of transportation.

source_sentence: 悉施罽那，即分一村落而賞封之。
translation: They all gave it to Cunda, who then divided the village into one village and rewarded it with a seal.

source_sentence: 華報如此，其果在後。
translation: The flower retribution is like this, but the fruit follows it.

source_sentence: （四三）◎罽夷羅夫婦自賣設會現獲報緣
translation: (43) ◎ Kauśina and Rāhula sell themselves to set up an assembly to attain their present rewards

source_sentence: 昔有一人，名罽夷羅，夫婦二人，貧窮理極，傭賃自活。
translation: In the old days there was a man named Kauśinagara, who lived on his own terms as a hired laborer. He and his wife were both poor and unable to earn their living.

source_sentence: 見他長者悉往寺中，作大施會，來歸家中，共婦止宿，頭枕婦臂，自思惟言：「由我前身不作福故，
translation: They all went to the monastery to perform a great sacrifice and came home. Accompanied by their wives, they spent the night together. Their heads touching each other’s arms, they thought to themselves, “Because I did not perform meritorious deeds in my previous existence we are now enjoying happiness.

source_sentence: 今日貧窮。
translation: Today, they're poor.

source_sentence: 如彼長者，先身作福，今亦作福；
translation: Good man, it is like the case of that wealthy man who did good deeds in his previous existence and now also does good deeds as well.

source_sentence: 我今無福，將來之世，唯轉苦劇。」
translation: Now, I have no merit, and in the future life, I'll only experience suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 作是念已，涕泣不樂，淚墮婦臂。
translation: After he had this thought, he wept and cried uncomfortably, shedding tears that fell into the woman’s arms.

source_sentence: 婦問夫言：「何以落淚？」
translation: The woman asked her husband, Why did she shed tears?

source_sentence: 答言：「見他修福常得快樂，自鄙貧賤，無以修福，是以落淚。」
translation: They replied, Seeing others cultivate goodness and always attain happiness, they despise themselves as poor and have no way to cultivate goodness; that's why they shed tears.

source_sentence: 婦言：「落淚何益？
translation: The woman said, What's the benefit of shedding tears?

source_sentence: 可以我身賣與他人取財作福。」
translation: You can sell me my body and give it to others to obtain wealth for their goods.

source_sentence: 夫言：「若當相賣，我身如何得自存活？」
translation: The husband said, If I were to sell it to you, how would I be able to survive on my own?

source_sentence: 婦言：「若恐不活不見出者，我今與君俱共自賣，而修功德。」
translation: The woman said, If I'm afraid I won't live and won't see you come out, I'll now sell myself to you and cultivate my merit.

source_sentence: 於是夫婦，便共相將，至一富家，而語之言：「今我夫婦，以此賤身，
translation: The husband and wife then went to a rich man’s house together. They said, “Now that our husband and wife are living in such a humble and unworthy place, how can we praise them?

source_sentence: 請貿金錢。」
translation: He asks for money to trade.

source_sentence: 主人問言：「欲得幾錢？」
translation: The host asked, How much money do you want to get?

source_sentence: 答言：「欲得十金錢。」
translation: He replied, I want to get ten coins.

source_sentence: 主人言：「今與汝錢，却後七日，不得償我，以汝夫婦，即為奴婢。」
translation: The host said, Now, I'll give you money; seven days from now, you won't be able to pay me back by your wife and children.

source_sentence: 言契以定，齎錢往詣，至彼塔寺，施設作會。
translation: He agreed to settle the matter, took his money, went to that stūpa and temple, set up an assembly, and assembled there.

source_sentence: 夫婦二人，自共搗米，相勸勵言：「今日我等得自出力而造福業，後屬他家，
translation: The two men and women pounded rice together, exhorting each other, saying, Today we have gained the power of self-discipline to perform meritorious deeds. We will belong to someone else’s family.

source_sentence: 豈從意也？」
translation: Is it from your mind?

source_sentence: 於是晝夜，懃辦會具，到六日頭，垂欲作會，值彼國主亦欲作會，來共諍日，
translation: Day and night, he prepared the necessary preparations for the assembly. On the sixth day [the king] wished to hold an assembly at the end of the rainy season. When he met the sovereign of that country, who also wished to host the assembly, he came to join him in holding it on the first day of the assembly.

source_sentence: 眾僧皆言：「以受窮者，終不得移。」
translation: The saṃgha all said, If you're poor, you won't be allowed to move.

source_sentence: 國主聞已，作是言曰：「彼何小人，敢能與我共諍會日？」
translation: After hearing this, the lord of the kingdom said, What small person would dare to fight with me on the day of the assembly?

source_sentence: 即遣人語罽羅：「汝避我日。」
translation: He then sent someone to tell Kālā, Don't stay away from me for days.

source_sentence: 罽羅答言：「實不相避。」
translation: Kālā answered, They really aren't avoiding each other.

source_sentence: 如是三反，執辭如初。
translation: Thus, these three times, he clings to the words as before.

source_sentence: 王怪所以，自至僧坊，語彼人言：「汝今何以不後日作，共我諍日？」
translation: The king wondered why he went to the saṃgha's quarters and said to that man, Why don't you do it on the day after tomorrow?

source_sentence: 答言：「唯一日自在，後屬他家，不復得作。」
translation: He replied, There's only one day when it's self-contained and belongs to someone else's home; it can't be done again.

source_sentence: 王即問言：「何以不得？」
translation: The king asked, Why won't you get it?

source_sentence: 自賣者言：「自惟先身不作福業，今日窮苦，今若不作，恐後轉苦。
translation: The merchant himself said, “I thought that I did not perform meritorious deeds in my previous existence. Today I am suffering from extreme pain. If I do not perform these deeds now, I am afraid of future suffering.

source_sentence: 感念此事，唯自賣身，以貿金錢，用作功德，欲斷此苦。
translation: Because of this, they only sell their own bodies to trade money for merit and want to end this suffering.

source_sentence: 至七日後，無財償他，即作奴婢。
translation: When seven days had passed, he didn't have the money to pay for it, so he became a slave or servant.

source_sentence: 今以六日，明日便滿，以是之故，分死諍日。」
translation: Now, it's because the sixth day will be over on the next day, and because of this, we'll share the days of death and rebirth.

source_sentence: 王聞是語，深生憐愍，歎未曾有：「汝真解悟貧窮之苦，能以不堅之身，
translation: Having heard these words, the king was deeply saddened and regretted this unprecedented occurrence. “Truly understand that you are enlightened about the suffering of poverty and how you can use your insubstantial body to endure it.

source_sentence: 易於堅身，不堅之財，易於堅財，不堅之命，易於堅命。」
translation: It's easy to change from a strong body that's not strong, property that's not strong, wealth that's strong, and life that's not strong.

source_sentence: 即聽設會，王以己身并及夫人衣服瓔珞，脫與罽羅夫婦，割十聚落，與作福封。
translation: He then listened and set up an assembly, and the king gave his own body, as well as his wife's clothing and jewelry, to Śāriputra and their husbands freely, cut down ten villages, and gave them a blessed seal of approval.

source_sentence: 夫能至心，修福德者，現得華報，猶尚如是，況其將來獲果報也。
translation: If someone can cultivate virtue with sincerity of mind, they'll attain the flowery rewards in the present, just like this, so why wouldn't they attain the fruit in the future?

source_sentence: 由此觀之，一切世人，欲得免苦，當懃修福，何足縱情懈怠放逸？
translation: Because of this observation, all the people in the world want to be freed from suffering and should diligently cultivate goodness, so why would they become lazy and careless?

source_sentence: （四四）◎沙彌救蟻子水災得長命報緣
translation: (24) Śrāmaṇer saves ants from the water disaster and obtains long life as a reward

source_sentence: 昔者有一羅漢道人，畜一沙彌，知此沙彌却後七日必當命終，與假歸家，
translation: Once there was an arhat monk of the Way who kept a novice. Knowing that he would surely die seven days after his departure, he gave him temporarily to return home.

source_sentence: 至七日頭，勅使還來。
translation: At the beginning of the seventh day, an envoy was ordered to return.

source_sentence: 沙彌辭師，即便歸去，於其道中，見眾蟻子，隨水漂流，命將欲絕，生慈悲心，
translation: The śrāmaṇer renounced his teacher and immediately departed. On the way he saw that the ants were floating in the water, about to die. He felt compassion and pity for them.

source_sentence: 自脫袈裟，盛土堰水，而取蟻子，置高燥處，遂悉得活。
translation: He took off his reddish-brown robes, filled them with dirt and water, collected the ants, placed them in a high dry place, and came back to life.

source_sentence: 至七日頭，還歸師所。
translation: At the end of the seventh day he returned to his teacher’s quarters.

source_sentence: 師甚怪之，尋即入定，以天眼觀，知其更無餘福得爾，以救蟻子因緣之故，
translation: The teacher found this very strange and immediately entered into meditative absorption. Observing with the divine eye, he knew that there would be no other blessedness for him to attain it. This was because of the cause and condition of saving the ant-child.

source_sentence: 七日不死，得延命長。
translation: He will not die for seven days and his life will be prolonged.

source_sentence: （四五）◎乾陀衛國王治故塔寺得延命緣
translation: 45. The King of Gandhārawei governs the old stūpa temple and obtains the condition for prolonging his life

source_sentence: 昔乾陀衛國，有一國主，有一明相師，占王，却後七日，必當命終。
translation: Formerly in the country of Gandhārawei there was a sovereign named Indra, who had a magician as his king and predicted that seven days from now he would surely die.

source_sentence: 出遊獵行，見一故塔，毀敗崩壞，即令群臣共修治之，修治已訖，歡喜還宮，
translation: He went out on a hunting excursion and saw an old stupa that had been decayed and disintegrated. So he ordered his ministers to work together with him to repair it. Having done so, the king joyfully returned to his palace.

source_sentence: 七日安隱。
translation: On the seventh day, he was peaceful.

source_sentence: 相師見過七日，怪其所以，問王言：「作何功德？」
translation: Seeing it for seven days, the soothsayer wondered why and asked the king, What merit did you do?

source_sentence: 答言：「更無所作，唯有一破塔，以埿補治。」
translation: He replied, There's nothing more to be done; there's only one broken stūpa that's patched with silk.

source_sentence: 由治塔故，功德如是。
translation: As a result of the purification of the stupas, their merits are like this.

source_sentence: （四六）比丘補寺壁孔獲延命報緣
translation: 46. The Condition by which a Bhikṣu is rewarded with prolonged life after he repairs the walls of his monastery

source_sentence: 昔有比丘，死時將至，會有外道婆羅門見，相是比丘，知七日後必當命終。
translation: Formerly there was a bhikṣu who was about to die. A heretical brahman saw him and knew that the bhikṣu would surely die seven days from now.

source_sentence: 時此比丘，因入僧坊，見壁有孔，即便團泥，而補塞之。
translation: When this monk entered the monastery, he saw a hole in the wall and filled it with mud to fill it up.

source_sentence: 緣此福故，增其壽命，得過七日。
translation: Due to this merit, his life span increases by more than seven days.

source_sentence: 婆羅門見，怪其所以，而問之言：「汝修何福？」
translation: Seeing this, the Brāhmaṇa wondered why and asked him, What merit are you cultivating?

source_sentence: 比丘答言：「我無所修，唯於昨日，入僧房中，見壁有孔，補治而已。」
translation: The monk answered, I don't have anything to cultivate; just yesterday, I entered the saṃgha's room and saw a hole in the wall that was merely patched.

source_sentence: 婆羅門歎言：「是僧福田，最為深重，能使應死比丘續命延壽。」
translation: The Brāhmaṇa praised him, saying, This is the most profound field of merit for the saṃgha, which will allow a monk who should die to continue his life and prolong his life.

source_sentence: （四七）◎長者子見佛求長命緣
translation: (47)◎The elder's son sees the Buddha and seeks long life as a condition

source_sentence: 昔佛在世，有一長者子，年五六歲。
translation: Once, when the Buddha was in the world, there was an elderly man's son, who was five or six years old.

source_sentence: 相師占之，福德具足，唯有短壽命。
translation: A soothsayer divined the existence of this image and found that it was endowed with great merit but had a short life span.

source_sentence: 將至外道六師所，望求長壽，瞋彼六師都無有能與長壽法。
translation: When he was about to go to the six non-Buddhist teachers who hoped to obtain long life, he became angry with those six teachers because they didn't have the ability to give him a long life.

source_sentence: 將至佛所，白佛言：「此子短壽，唯願世尊與其長壽。」
translation: He was about to go to the Buddha and said to him, This child has a short life span; may the Bhagavān give him a long life span!

source_sentence: 佛言：「無有是法能與長壽。」
translation: The Buddha said, There's no such thing that can give long life.

source_sentence: 重白佛言：「願示方便。」
translation: He repeatedly said to the Buddha, May I show you how to do it?

source_sentence: 佛時教言：「汝到城門下，見人出者，為之作禮，入者亦禮。」
translation: The Buddha then said, Go down to the city gates and see someone coming out, make obeisance for them, and those who enter will also pay homage.

source_sentence: 時有一鬼神，化作婆羅門身，欲來入城，小兒向禮，鬼呪願言：「使汝長壽。」
translation: A spirit then appeared in the form of a Brāhmaṇa and wanted to enter the city, but the boy bowed to him.

source_sentence: 此鬼乃是殺小兒鬼，但鬼神之法，不得二語，以許長壽，更不得殺。
translation: This ghost is a demon who kills children. However, it is the custom of these ghosts and goddesses not to speak in two ways. Because they allow long life, they cannot be killed.

source_sentence: 以其如是謙忍恭敬，得延壽命。
translation: Because they are thus humble, patient, respectful, and venerable, their life will be prolonged.

source_sentence: （四八）◎長者子客作設會獲現報緣
translation: 48. The elder's guest creates the conditions for setting up an assembly to attain present rewards

source_sentence: 昔佛在世時，有長者子，早喪父母，孤窮伶俜，客作自活。
translation: Formerly, when the Buddha was living in the world, there was an elderly man’s son who had lost his parents at an early age. Being orphaned and helpless, he lived on his own as a guest.

source_sentence: 聞有人說忉利天上，極為快樂，又聞他說供養佛僧，必得往生，即問他言：「用幾許物，
translation: When someone hears someone say that the Trāyastriṃśa gods are extremely blissful, and when they hear others make offerings to the Buddha and Saṃgha, they'll surely be reborn. They then ask, How much does it cost?

source_sentence: 可得供佛及以眾僧？」
translation: Can you make offerings to the Buddha and the saṃgha?

source_sentence: 時人語言：「用三十兩金，可得作會。」
translation: The people then said, Use thirty taels of gold to make an assembly.

source_sentence: 便來向市，求客作處。
translation: He then came to the marketplace and asked the guest to make a place for him.

source_sentence: 市邊有一大富長者，雇其客作，長者問言：「汝今能作何事？」
translation: A large wealthy man at the edge of the marketplace hired a guest to work for him, and the man asked, What can you do now?

source_sentence: 答言：「是作皆能。」
translation: He replied, They're all capable of doing this.

source_sentence: 「三年客作，索幾許物？」
translation: How many things did the three-year guest ask for?

source_sentence: 答言：「索三十兩金。」
translation: He replied, They asked for thirty taels of gold.

source_sentence: 長者聞其事事皆能，即雇使作。
translation: When the elder heard that he could do all these things, he hired an envoy to do them.

source_sentence: 為人端直，金銀銅鐵，種種肆上，得利倍常。
translation: For the sake of human uprightness, gold, silver, copper, and iron are offered in various ways to increase profit even more frequently.

source_sentence: 日月以滿，從彼長者，索作價金。
translation: When the sun and moon were full, he asked the elder to make a price for it.

source_sentence: 長者問言：「汝今得金，用作何事？」
translation: The elder asked, Now that you've obtained gold, what will you use it for?

source_sentence: 答言：「我欲供養佛僧。」
translation: He replied, I want to make offerings to the buddhas and saṃgha.

source_sentence: 長者語言：「我今佐汝，及以種種瓫器米麵，與汝作食，汝但請佛及以眾僧。」
translation: The elder said, Now, I'll assist you with various cooked rice vessels and rice and porridge to make food for you; just ask the Buddha and the saṃgha to give it to you.

source_sentence: 即詣僧房，請佛及僧。
translation: He went to the monks' quarters and invited the Buddha and the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 佛使眾僧皆受其請，佛住自房，眾僧皆受彼長者子請。
translation: The Buddha's envoy and the saṃgha all accepted his invitation, and the Buddha stayed in his own room, and the saṃgha all accepted the invitation of that wealthy man's son.

source_sentence: 正值節日，眾人皆送種種飲食，往與眾僧。
translation: On the first day of the festival, all the people offered various foods and drinks to the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 眾僧食飽，到長者舍。
translation: The saṃgha ate and went to the house of the wealthy merchant.

source_sentence: 時長者子，手自行食，上座言：「少著。」
translation: The elder's son then ate with his own hands, and the superior monk said, Lest you get attached.

source_sentence: 次第皆言少著，至訖下行。
translation: In order, they're all said to be little attached, up to the point where they're done.

source_sentence: 時長者子，啼哭懊惱，「辛苦三年，設此飲食，望眾僧食；
translation: The son of the wealthy man cried in distress and said, “Throughout three years of hardship I set up this food and drink for the assembly to eat.

source_sentence: 僧不為食，我求生天，必不得生。」
translation: If the saṃgha doesn't eat it, and I seek birth in heaven, I won't be born.

source_sentence: 往至佛邊，白佛言：「眾僧不食我供，而我所願，必當不得。」
translation: He went to the Buddha's side and said to him, The saṃgha won't eat my offerings, but what I want will surely not be obtained.

source_sentence: 佛言：「少食以不？」
translation: The Buddha said, Is there a little food?

source_sentence: 答言：「皆悉少食。」
translation: He replied, They all eat little.

source_sentence: 佛言：「假使不食汝願必成，況復少食而不成也？」
translation: The Buddha said, Suppose you don't eat, and your vow will surely be fulfilled, so why wouldn't it be fulfilled with a little food?

source_sentence: 童子歡喜，還來飲食。
translation: The boy was delighted, and returned with food and drink.

source_sentence: 彼時眾僧食訖即還。
translation: The saṃgha then returned after they had finished eating.

source_sentence: 時有五百賈客，入海來還，入城募索飲食。
translation: At the time, there were five hundred merchants who came back and forth from the sea and entered the city to solicit food and drink.

source_sentence: 時世飢饉，無有與者。
translation: At the time, there was a hunger in the world and no one gave it to him.

source_sentence: 有人語言：「彼長者子，今日設會，必有飲食。」
translation: Someone said, That elder's son, there must be food and drink at the assembly today.

source_sentence: 時長者子，聞有賈客，歡喜與食，五百賈客，皆得充足，一切將從，悉亦飽滿。
translation: When the wealthy man's son heard that there were merchants, he rejoiced and gave them food, and the five hundred merchants all had enough to eat. All of them were about to follow him, and they were also full.

source_sentence: 最下賈客，解一珠與，直萬兩金；
translation: The lowest merchant offered him a pearl worth ten thousand taels of gold.

source_sentence: 最上頭者，解一珠與，直十萬兩金。
translation: The highest head is given with a single pearl, worth 100,000 taels of gold.

source_sentence: 五百賈客，人與一珠，與一銅盔，與此長者子，而不敢取。
translation: Five hundred merchants gave a pearl and a copper sash to this wealthy man's son, but they didn't dare to take it.

source_sentence: 往走問佛，佛言：「此是華報，但取無苦，後必生天，不足恐懼。」
translation: They ran to the Buddha and asked him, saying, This is the flower reward, but it's not painful to take it; you'll surely be born in heaven later, so don't fear it.

source_sentence: 主人長者，更無男兒，唯有一女，即與童子。
translation: The host and the wealthy man had no children. There was only one daughter who gave them to the boy.

source_sentence: 如是家業，遂大熾盛，舍衛城中，最為第一。
translation: As a result, the family business prospered greatly and was the foremost in the city of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 長者命終，波斯匿王，聞其聰明智見，以其家業，悉乞與之。
translation: When the wealthy man’s life came to an end, King Prasenajit heard of his intelligence and wisdom and begged him to give it to him because of his family business.

source_sentence: 華報如是，其果在後。
translation: The flower retribution is like this, with its fruit at the back.

source_sentence: （四九）◎弗那施佛鉢食獲現報緣
translation: 49. The Condition for Obtaining the Present Retribution for Giving Food to the Buddha's Bowl by Pūrṇa

source_sentence: 昔佛在世，有梵志兄弟五人，一名耶奢。
translation: Formerly, when the Buddha was living in the world, there were five brāhmaṇa disciples named Yaśas.

source_sentence: 二名無垢，三名憍梵波提，四名蘇馱夷；
translation: The second is called Undefiled, the third Gavāṃpati, and the fourth Sudarśana.

source_sentence: 四兄入山學道，得五神通。
translation: The fourth brother entered the mountain to study the Way and attained the five supernatural powers.

source_sentence: 其最小弟，名曰弗那，見佛乞食，盛好白淨飯，滿鉢施佛。
translation: The youngest disciple, named Puṣkarasārin, saw the Buddha begging for food and gave him a bowl full of good white rice.

source_sentence: 爾時弗那，恒以耕種為業，時耕種訖，還歸于家。
translation: At the time, Pūrṇa always made cultivation his occupation, and when he finished cultivating it, he returned home.

source_sentence: 後於一日，出到田中，見其田中，所生苗稼，變成金禾，皆長數尺，收刈已盡，
translation: One day he came out and went into the field. He saw that all the crops grown in the fields turned into golden grains, several feet long, which had been harvested and harvested to maturity.

source_sentence: 還生如初。
translation: It returns to birth as before.

source_sentence: 國王聞之，亦來收刈，不能得盡，如是一切，諸來取者，皆不能盡。
translation: When the king heard this, he also came to harvest it but could not get all of it; and so on, and none of the people who came to harvest it could do so.

source_sentence: 兄等念言：「我弟弗那，為得生活，為貧苦耶？」
translation: The brothers thought, My younger brother, Pūrṇa, is it because you're living and suffering from poverty?

source_sentence: 尋共來看，見弟福業踰於國王，便語弟言：「汝先貧窮，云何卒富？」
translation: Seeing that his younger brother's meritorious activities exceeded those of the king, he said to his younger brother, You were poor before, so how could you suddenly become rich?

source_sentence: 答言：「我見瞿曇，施一鉢飯，得如是報。」
translation: He replied, I've seen Gautama give me a bowl of rice and get such a reward.

source_sentence: 四兄聞已，歡喜踊躍，又語弟言：「爾今為我，作歡喜團，我等四人，
translation: When the four brothers heard this, they were overjoyed and jumped for joy. They said to their younger brothers, “You should now make a lump of joy for me.

source_sentence: 各持一團，供養瞿曇，願求生天，不聽其法，不用解脫。」
translation: Each of them held a lump of food to offer to Gautama and wished to be born in heaven, but they didn't hear his teaching and didn't use liberation.

source_sentence: 於是各擔歡喜團，往至佛所，大兄捉一團，著佛鉢中，佛言：「諸行無常。」
translation: Each of them then carried a lump of joy and went to the Buddha, where their big brother grabbed a lump and put it in the Buddha's bowl, and the Buddha said, All things are impermanent.

source_sentence: 第二復以歡喜團，著佛鉢中，佛作是語：「是生滅法。」
translation: Second, he puts the joy lump into the Buddha's bowl and puts it in his bowl, and the Buddha says, This is the law of arising and ceasing.

source_sentence: 第三復以歡喜之團，著佛鉢裏，佛作是語：「生滅滅已。」
translation: Third, he puts a lump of joy in the Buddha's bowl and puts it inside the Buddha's bowl, and the Buddha says, After arising and ceasing, they cease.

source_sentence: 第四復以歡喜之團，著佛鉢中，佛作是語：「寂滅為樂。」
translation: Fourth, he again puts a lump of joy into the Buddha's bowl and puts it in his bowl, and the Buddha says, Tranquil extinction is bliss.

source_sentence: 即還歸家，至寂靜處，共相問言：「汝聞何語？」
translation: They returned home, went to a quiet place, and asked each other, What did you hear?

source_sentence: 第一兄言：「我聞諸行無常。」
translation: The first brother said, I've heard that all conditioned things are impermanent.

source_sentence: 次者復聞是生滅法，又次者聞生滅滅已，第四者聞寂滅為樂。
translation: The second is to hear again that this is the teaching of arising and ceasing, and the second is to hear that after arising and ceasing cease, the fourth is to hear that cessation is bliss.

source_sentence: 兄弟四人，各思此偈，得阿那含，皆來佛所，求為出家，得阿羅漢道。
translation: Each of the four brothers thought this verse and attained non-returner, so they all came to the Buddha, asked to leave home, and attained the path of the arhat.

source_sentence: （五〇）大愛道施佛金縷織成衣并穿珠師緣
translation: (30) Greatly Desired Way gives the Buddha gold thread, weaves his garments and wears the pearl-worker's conditions

source_sentence: 昔佛在世，大愛道為佛作金縷織成衣，齎來上佛，佛即語言：「用施眾僧。」
translation: Formerly, when the Buddha was in the world, Mahāprajñāpāramitā wore robes made of gold thread for the Buddha and brought them to the Buddha, who said, Give them to the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 大愛道言：「我以乳餔長養世尊，自作此衣，故來奉佛，必望如來為我受之。
translation: The great beloved monk said, “I nourish the World-honored One with milk and butter. Because I made these robes for myself, I came to offer them to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 云何方言與眾僧也？」
translation: How can we say it's shared with the saṃgha?

source_sentence: 佛言：「欲使姨母得大功德。
translation: The Buddha said, I want to cause my aunt to attain great merit.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 眾僧福田，廣大無邊，是故勸爾。
translation: The field of merit of the Sangha is vast and limitless, so I encourage you to do so.

source_sentence: 若隨我語，已供養佛。」
translation: If you follow my words, you've already made offerings to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 時大愛道，即持此衣，往到僧中，從上座行，無敢取者。
translation: Mahāprajāpaṇa then took this robe, went to the saṃgha, walked from the superior seat, and didn't dare to take it.

source_sentence: 次到彌勒，彌勒受衣，即著入城乞食。
translation: When he arrived at Maitreya, Maitreya accepted his robes and went into the city to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 彌勒身有三十二相，紫磨金色，既到城裏，眾人競看，無與食者。
translation: Maitreya’s body had thirty-two distinctive marks and was purplish-gold in color. When he arrived at the city, all the citizens rushed to see him but no one offered food to him.

source_sentence: 有一穿珠師，見諸人等無與食者，即前跪請，將至家中，與彌勒食。
translation: When a pearl piercer saw that the people didn't give him food, he knelt down and invited them to go home and gave Maitreya food.

source_sentence: 彌勒食訖，時穿珠師，以一小座，敷彌勒前，求欲聽法。
translation: When Maitreya had finished his meal, the pearl-cutter took a small seat and spread it out in front of Maitreya, wanting to hear the Dharma.

source_sentence: 彌勒有四辯才力，即便為說種種妙法。
translation: Maitreya had the power of four kinds of eloquence, and even explained various wonderful teachings for him.

source_sentence: 時穿珠師，願樂聽聞，無有厭足。
translation: At the time, the pearl- piercing master wished to hear it, but he didn't tire of listening.

source_sentence: 先有長者，將欲嫁女，雇穿珠師，穿一寶珠，與錢十萬。
translation: There was once an elderly man who wished to marry a woman and hired a pearl-wearing jewelry maker to wear a precious pearl for 100,000 coins.

source_sentence: 當此之時，彼嫁女家，遣人索珠。
translation: At the time, they married into a woman's family and sent someone to ask for the pearl.

source_sentence: 時穿珠師，聽法情濃，不暇為穿，即答之言：「且可小待須臾之頃。」
translation: When the pearl- piercing master heard that his feeling for the Dharma was so strong that he didn't have time to pierce it, he answered him, Please wait a little while.

source_sentence: 已復來索，乃至三返猶故不得。
translation: After coming back, he asked for it again, and even after three times returning, he still couldn't get it.

source_sentence: 彼長者瞋，合其珠錢還來奪去。
translation: Being angry, the elder folded his bead money and returned to take it away.

source_sentence: 穿珠師婦，瞋其夫言：「更無業也，須臾穿珠，得十萬利，云何聽此道人美說？」
translation: The woman who pierced the pearl became angry with her husband, saying, There's nothing more to be done; if you pierce the pearl in a moment, you'll attain 100,000 benefits, so how can you listen to the good words of this man of the Way?

source_sentence: 其夫聞已，意中恨恨。
translation: On hearing this, the husband resented it in his mind.

source_sentence: 爾時彌勒，知其恨恨，即問之言：「汝能隨我，至寺以不？」
translation: Knowing his resentment, Maitreya then asked him, Can you follow me to the temple?

source_sentence: 答言：「我能。」
translation: He replied, I can.

source_sentence: 即隨彌勒，往僧坊中，問上座言：「有人得金滿十萬斤，何如歡喜聽人說法？」
translation: He then followed Maitreya into the saṃgha's hall and asked the superior monk, Suppose someone were to obtain 100,000 pounds of gold, so how could they rejoice in listening to the teaching?

source_sentence: 憍陳如言：「假使有人得金十萬，不如有人以一鉢食施持戒者，況能信心須臾聽法，
translation: Kauṇḍinya thus said, Suppose someone were to obtain 100,000 pieces of gold, it wouldn't be as good for someone to give a bowlful of food to someone who upholds the precepts, so how could they believe and listen to the teaching for a moment?

source_sentence: 復勝於彼百千萬倍。」
translation: It's a hundred million times greater than that.

source_sentence: 於是又問第二上座，上座答言：「設復有人得十萬車金，亦不如以一鉢之食施持戒者，
translation: He then asked the second superior monk again. The superior monk answered, “Suppose another man were to obtain 100,000 carriages of gold; it is not advisable for him to offer a bowlful of food to anyone who keeps the precepts.

source_sentence: 況復聽法歡喜，經於時節。」
translation: It's even more so when he hears the teaching and rejoices, passing through the seasons.

source_sentence: 又復問於第三上座，上座答言：「若有人得十萬舍金，亦復不如施持戒人一鉢之食，
translation: Again, he asked the third superior monk. The superior monk answered, Suppose someone were to obtain 100,000 sheep of gold, which is not as good as giving a bowlful of food to a person who keeps the precepts.

source_sentence: 況復聽法？」
translation: How could it be possible to hear the teaching?

source_sentence: 又問第四上座，上座答言：「若其有得十萬國金，亦復不如施持戒人一鉢之食，
translation: Again, he asked the fourth superior monk. The superior monk answered, “If they obtained one hundred thousand pieces of gold in ten thousand countries, it would not be as good as giving a bowlful of food to those who keep the precepts.

source_sentence: 況復聽法，百千萬倍。」
translation: How much more so when he hears the teaching, a hundred million times.

source_sentence: 如是次問乃至阿那律，阿那律言：「有人得滿四天下金，猶故不如施持戒人一鉢之食，
translation: He asked further in this order up to Aniruddha, who said, Suppose someone were to obtain gold that filled the four quarters of the earth and therefore wouldn't be as good as giving a bowlful of food to a person who observed precepts.

source_sentence: 況復聽法？」
translation: How could it be possible to hear the teaching?

source_sentence: 彌勒答言：「尊者說言有施比丘一鉢之食，乃至勝得滿四天下金，云何如是？」
translation: Maitreya replied, Venerable, What's the way it is when you say there's a monk who gives a bowlful of food to a given monk, up to the point where he's victoriously able to fill the four worlds with gold?

source_sentence: 尊者答言：「以自身為證，憶念往昔九十億劫，有一長者，有其二子，
translation: The Venerable answered, “I remember that in the past, when there were ninety koṭis of kalpas, there was an elderly man who had two sons.

source_sentence: 一名利吒，二名阿利吒，恒告之言：『高者亦墮，常者亦盡，夫生有死，
translation: The first is called Liṭṭa, and the second Ariṣṭa. He always tells them, “Those who are tall also fall down; those who are eternal also perish. Birth has death.

source_sentence: 合會有離。』
translation: They'll be united and separated from each other.'

source_sentence: 長者得病，臨命終時，約勅兒子：『慎莫分居。
translation: When the wealthy man became ill and died, he instructed his sons to be careful not to live separately.

source_sentence: 譬如一絲不能繫象，多集諸絲，象不能絕。
translation: It's like a single thread that can't bind an elephant, and when many threads gather together, the elephant can't stop.

source_sentence: 兄弟並立，亦如多絲。』
translation: The brothers are standing together, just like many threads.'

source_sentence: 時彼長者，囑誡子竟，氣絕命終。
translation: The wealthy man then instructed his son to finish the instructions, and he died of exhaustion.

source_sentence: 以父勅故，兄弟共活，極相敬念。
translation: Because of my father’s edict, the two brothers lived together in great respect and affection.

source_sentence: 後為弟娶婦，生活未幾，而此弟婦語其夫言：『汝如彼奴。
translation: Soon afterward, he married his wife for his younger brother. But the latter had only a short life span and said to her husband, “You are like that slave.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 錢財用度，應當人客，皆由汝兄，汝今唯得衣食而已，非奴如何？』
translation: The money, possessions, and expenses are all due to your brother; now you've only obtained food and clothing, so what if it's not a slave?'

source_sentence: 數作此語。
translation: He repeatedly said these words.

source_sentence: 爾時夫婦，心生變異，求兄分居。
translation: At the time, the couple had a change in mind and asked their brother to live separately.

source_sentence: 兄語弟言：『汝不憶父臨終之言？』
translation: The elder brother said to his younger brother, 'Don't you remember the words of your father when he died?'

source_sentence: 猶不自改，數求分居。
translation: They still did not change their ways and frequently sought different dwelling places.

source_sentence: 兄見弟意，正便與分居，一切所有，皆中半分。
translation: When the elder brother saw what his younger brother wished, he gave it to him as a separate dwelling, and half of everything he possessed.

source_sentence: 弟之夫婦，年少遊逸，用度奢侈，未經幾時，貧窮困匱，來從兄乞。
translation: The younger brother’s wife and children were traveling in a leisurely way, indulging in extravagant luxuries. Soon afterward they became poor and destitute and came to beg from their elder brother.

source_sentence: 其兄爾時，與錢十萬，得去未久，以復用盡，而更來索。
translation: At the time, his brother gave him 100,000 pieces of money. Not long after he had left, he ran out and came back to ask for it again.

source_sentence: 如是六返，皆與十萬。
translation: Each of these six rebirths was given 100,000.

source_sentence: 至第七返，兄便責數：『汝不念父臨終之言，求於分異，不能乃心生活，
translation: On the seventh occasion, when he returned home, his elder brother said to him repeatedly, “You should not think of your father’s words at the end of his life. If you seek a different livelihood, then you will be unable to earn a living.

source_sentence: 數來索物；
translation: They frequently came to ask for things.

source_sentence: 今更與汝十萬之錢，從今已往，不好生活，重復來索，更不與汝。』
translation: Now, I'll give you another 100,000 pieces of money, and from now on, it won't be easy to live; I'll ask again and again, and I won't give them to you.'

source_sentence: 得是苦語，夫婦二人，用心生活，以漸得富。
translation: When they heard these painful words, the two men and women earned a living by means of their hearts in order to gradually attain wealth.

source_sentence: 兄錢財喪失，以漸貧窮，來從弟乞，其弟乃至不讓兄食，而作是言：『謂兄常富，
translation: When his brother’s money and property were in distress, he became gradually impoverished and came to beg for food from his younger brother. The younger brother begged without giving it to the elder brother, saying:

source_sentence: 亦復貧耶？
translation: Is it also poor?

source_sentence: 我昔從汝，有所乞索，苦切見責，今日何故，來從我索？』
translation: In the past, I begged you for something from you, and now why did you come here to ask me for it?'

source_sentence: 兄聞此已，極生憂惱，自作念言：『同生兄弟，猶尚如此，況於外人？』
translation: After hearing this, the brother became extremely distressed and thought to himself, 'My brothers who are born together are still like this, so why wouldn't they be like those outsiders?'

source_sentence: 厭惡生死，遂不還家，入山學道，精懃苦行，得辟支佛。
translation: Being disgusted with birth and death, he then didn't return home, went into the mountains to train in the path, exerted himself as an ascetic, and attained pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 其弟後亦以漸貧窮，遭世飢饉，賣薪自活。
translation: His younger brother later became poor and starved in the world, selling firewood for his livelihood.

source_sentence: 時辟支佛，入城乞食，竟無所得，空鉢還出。
translation: The pratyekabuddha then entered the city to solicit alms, but he didn't obtain anything, and returned with an empty bowl.

source_sentence: 時賣薪人，見辟支佛空鉢出城，即以賣薪所得稗麨，而欲與之，語辟支佛言：『尊者能食麤惡食不？』
translation: When the firewood merchant saw the pratyekabuddha's empty bowl leaving the city, he gave it to him with the wood he sold and said to the pratyekabuddha, 'Would you like to eat the bad food of the venerable?'

source_sentence: 答言：『不問好惡，趣得支身。』
translation: He replied, 'I won't ask about good and evil, but I'll go to the branch body.'

source_sentence: 時賣薪人，即便授與。
translation: The firewood seller then gave it to him.

source_sentence: 辟支佛受而食之，食訖之後，飛騰虛空，作十八變，即還所止。
translation: The pratyekabuddha accepted it and ate it. After having eaten the food, he flew up into the sky in eighteen ways and immediately returned to where he was staying.

source_sentence: 時賣薪人，後更取薪，道見一兔，以杖撩之，變成死人，卒起而來，抱取薪人項，
translation: The firewood seller then went on to fetch the firewood. On the roadway he saw a rabbit, which was pushed away with its staff and transformed into a dead corpse. Suddenly it rose up and came back, clinging to the neck of the firewood owner.

source_sentence: 彼取薪人，種種方便，欲推令去，不能得離，脫衣雇人，使挽却之，亦不得離；
translation: Those who collected the firewood wanted to drive it away but could not get rid of it. They took off their clothes and hired someone else to pull it, but they were unable to do so.

source_sentence: 展轉至闇，負來向家，既到家中，死人自解，墮在於地，作真金人。
translation: When he arrived home, the dead man got up on his own and fell to the ground, forming a man of true gold.

source_sentence: 時賣薪人，即便截却金人之頭，頭尋還生，却其手脚，手脚還生，須臾之間，
translation: The firewood seller then cut off the golden figure’s hair and its head. The hair grew back into existence, but when he took off his hands and feet, their hands and feet grew back into existence in a moment.

source_sentence: 金頭金手滿其屋裏，積為大[卄\/積]。
translation: Their heads and hands of gold filled the room, accumulating into a great heap.

source_sentence: 隣比告官：『此貧窮人，屋裏自然有此金[卄\/積]。』
translation: The neighboring monk told the official, 'This poor man naturally has this amount of gold [twenty\/gauge] in his room.'

source_sentence: 王聞遣使，往覆撿之。
translation: When the king heard this, he sent an envoy to collect and examine the relics.

source_sentence: 即到屋裏，純見爛臭死人手頭。
translation: When he arrived inside the room, he simply saw the rotten and smelly head of the dead man's hand.

source_sentence: 其人自捉金頭，來以上王，便是真金。
translation: That man grabbed the gold head for himself and came up to the king, who said, It's real gold.

source_sentence: 王大歡喜：『此是福人。』
translation: The king rejoiced greatly, saying, 'This is a blessed person.'

source_sentence: 即封聚落。
translation: He then sealed the village.

source_sentence: 從是命終，生第二天，為天帝釋，下生人中，為轉輪聖王，天王人王，
translation: At the end of his life, he was reborn in the second heaven as Indra, ruler of gods and goddesses. He was reborn among humans as Cakravartin (cakravartin King), ruler of gods and humans.

source_sentence: 九十一劫，不曾斷絕。
translation: For ninety-one world ages it never perished.

source_sentence: 今最後身，生於釋種，初生之日，四十里中，伏藏珍寶，自然踊出。
translation: In his last body, he was born among the Śākya people. On the day of his first birth, forty li away from here, he concealed treasures and came out spontaneously.

source_sentence: 後漸長大，兄釋摩男，父母偏愛，阿那律母，欲試諸兒，時遣語無食。
translation: When he gradually grew up, his elder brother Śākyamuni's parents were partial to him and Aniruddha's mother wanted to test his children, so she sent word that there would be no food.

source_sentence: 阿那律言：『但擔無食來。』
translation: Aniruddha said, 'It's just a burden of food that doesn't come.'

source_sentence: 即與空器，時空器中，百味飯食，自然盈滿。
translation: He then gave it to an empty container, and when he filled the empty container with a hundred flavors of rice and food, they naturally filled it.

source_sentence: 設以四天下金，用為乳哺，不足一劫，況九十一劫，常受快樂。
translation: Even if he were to use the gold of the four quarters of the earth as milk, it wouldn't be enough for an eon, so why wouldn't ninety-one eons always experience happiness?

source_sentence: 所以我今得此自然飲食，適由先身施此一鉢之食，今得此報，上至諸佛，
translation: That is why I have now obtained this food and drink of my own accord. As a consequence, having previously offered it to the Buddha with one bowlful of food, I am now receiving this reward that goes so far as to reach all buddhas.

source_sentence: 下至梵天，淨持戒者，皆名持戒。」
translation: Down to the Brahma gods, those who purely observe precepts are all called observing precepts.

source_sentence: 時穿珠師，聞是語已，心大歡喜。
translation: Having heard these words, the pearl piercer was greatly delighted.
